statement:
Suppose that $G \subset {\mathbb{C}}$ is a region.

A set ${\mathcal{F}}$ of holomorphic functions
$f\colon G \to {\mathbb{C}}$ is if and only if ${\mathcal{F}}$ is
locally bounded.

In other words a sequence of holomorphic functions $\{ f_n \}$ has a
subsequence which converges uniformly on compact subsets to a
holomorphic function $f \colon G \to {\mathbb{C}}$ if and only if the
set $\{ f_n \}$ is locally bounded.
